chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
instr: Set
data: Type
one_step: instr -> state -> state -> Prop
sss_fun: forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_dec: forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2}
P: code
pre: data -> Prop
spec: data -> data -> Prop
f: data -> data
Hf: forall x : data, x <> f x
C2: data -> Prop
C1: data -> Prop
HC: forall x : data, pre x -> {C1 x} + {C2 x}
p: nat
i: nat
Hp: out_code p P
HP1: forall x : data, pre x -> C1 x -> P // (i, x) ->> (i, f x) /\ pre (f x)
HP2: forall x : data, pre x -> C2 x -> exists y : data, P // (i, x) ->> (p, y) /\ spec x y
y: data
x: data
q: nat

Goal:
pre x -> out_code q P -> P // (i, x) ->> (q, y) -> p = q /\ (exists n : nat, C2 (iter f x n) /\ spec (iter f x n) y)

Premises:
iter : forall X : Type, (X -> X) -> X -> nat -> X
Notation state := (nat * data)%type
out_code : nat -> subcode.code ?X -> Prop where ?X : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code pre : data -> Prop spec : data -> data -> Prop f : data -> data Hf : forall x : data, x <> f x C1 : data -> Prop C2 : data -> Prop HC : forall x : data, pre x -> {C1 x} + {C2 x} i : nat p : nat
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Tauto.X : ?TX -> Tauto.GFormula where ?TA : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code pre : data -> Prop spec : data -> data -> Prop f : data -> data Hf : forall x : data, x <> f x C1 : data -> Prop C2 : data -> Prop HC : forall x : data, pre x ->...-> > (p, y) /\ spec x y x : data y : data q : nat |- Type]
VectorSpec.cons_inj : VectorDef.cons ?A ?a1 ?n ?v1 = VectorDef.cons ?A ?a2 ?n ?v2 -> ?a1 = ?a2 /\ ?v1 = ?v2 where ?A : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code pre : data -> Prop spec : data -> data -> Prop f : data ->...-> > (p, y) /\ spec x y x : data y : data q : nat |- VectorDef.t ?A ?n]
Tauto.D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula where ?TA : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code pre : data -> Prop spec : data -> data -> Prop f : data -> data Hf : forall x : data, x <> f x C1 : data -> Prop C2 : data -> Prop HC : forall x : data, pre x ->...-> > (p, y) /\ spec x y x : data y : data q : nat |- Type]
